section.title: Drawing Object Model: Tree Structure
section.para: A drawing is represented as a tree structure.
The tree structure is implemented with the composite design pattern using the Figure type as shown in figure .

mediaobject.caption: A drawing is represented as a tree structure of figures.

listitem.para: Tree traversal methods are defined in the separate interface named TreeNode.
Composite figures and leaf figures do not have distinct types.
A leaf figure returns false if asked whether it allows children. Its collection of child figures is unmodifiable, and always empty.
A composite figure returns true if asked whether it allows children. Its collection of child figures is modifiable.
By convention, a composite figure updates the parent property of a child figure, when a child figure is removed or added to the composite figure. No other objects may update the parent property.

Method isSuitableParent() allows to prevent undesired tree structures. A figure which returns false for a specific figure throws an UnsupportedOperationException on an attempt to set that specific figure as the parent of the figure.
